skill.name: stable-baselines3
skill.description: Use this skill for reinforcement learning tasks including training RL agents (PPO, SAC, DQN, TD3, DDPG, A2C, etc.), creating custom Gym environments, implementing callbacks for monitoring and control, using vectorized environments for parallel training, and integrating with deep RL workflows. This skill should be used when users request RL algorithm implementation, agent training, environment design, or RL experimentation.
skill.summary: Use this skill for reinforcement learning tasks including training RL agents (PPO, SAC, DQN, TD3, DD...
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: This is a pure documentation and template code skill for Stable Baselines3 reinforcement learning. All Python scripts are standard RL templates using only local file operations for model/log directories. No network calls, no command execution, no environment variable access, no sensitive data collection. All 411 static findings are false positives from markdown code blocks being misidentified as shell commands.

content.value_statement: Reinforcement learning requires deep expertise in algorithms, environments, and training workflows. This skill provides ready-to-use templates and guides for Stable Baselines3 so you can quickly train RL agents without learning all the details upfront.
actual_capabilities: Train RL agents using PPO, SAC, DQN, TD3, A2C, DDPG, and HER algorithms
Create custom Gymnasium environments compatible with Stable Baselines3
Implement callbacks for monitoring, checkpointing, and early stopping
Use vectorized environments for parallel training performance
Evaluate trained agents with statistics and video recording
limitations: Template code requires user to specify environment and paths
Does not handle hyperparameter tuning automatically

use_cases.title: Deploy RL for robotics
use_cases.description: Train continuous control policies for robotics using SAC or TD3 with parallel environments.

use_cases.title: Build game-playing agents
use_cases.description: Create agents that learn to play games using PPO or DQN with custom environments.

use_cases.title: Experiment with RL algorithms
use_cases.description: Prototype new RL approaches using callbacks, custom environments, and comparisons.

prompt_templates.title: Train basic agent
prompt_templates.scenario: I want to train a PPO agent
prompt_templates.prompt: Train a PPO agent on CartPole-v1. Use 4 parallel environments, save checkpoints every 10000 steps, and log to TensorBoard. Show me the complete training code.

prompt_templates.title: Create custom environment
prompt_templates.scenario: I need a custom Gym environment
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a custom Gymnasium environment where an agent navigates a 10x10 grid to reach a goal. Include observation space, action space, and reward function.

prompt_templates.title: Add monitoring callbacks
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up evaluation callbacks that save the best model, stop training when reward exceeds 200, and log custom metrics to TensorBoard during PPO training.

prompt_templates.title: Optimize training
prompt_templates.prompt: Show me how to use SubprocVecEnv with 8 parallel environments, VecNormalize for reward normalization, and checkpoint frequency for efficient SAC training.

output_examples.input: Train a PPO agent on CartPole with checkpoints and evaluation
output: Created 4 parallel training environments using SubprocVecEnv
Set up EvalCallback: evaluates every 2500 steps, saves best model to ./models/best_model/
Set up CheckpointCallback: saves every 2500 steps with prefix 'ppo_cartpole'
Initialized PPO with MlpPolicy, learning_rate=3e-4, n_steps=2048
Training for 100000 timesteps with TensorBoard logging to ./logs/

output_examples.input: Create a custom environment for robot navigation
output: Defined observation space as Box(shape=(15,), dtype=np.float32) for sensor readings
Defined action space as Box(shape=(2,), low=-1, high=1) for continuous control
Implemented step() returning observation, reward, terminated, truncated, info
Added reward function based on distance to target plus penalty for collisions
Validated environment with check_env() - all tests passed

best_practices: Always validate custom environments with check_env() before training
Divide eval_freq and save_freq by n_envs when using vectorized environments
Save VecNormalize statistics separately from model for correct evaluation
anti_patterns: Using DQN with continuous action spaces (only works with discrete actions)
Not adjusting hyperparameters when switching between on-policy and off-policy algorithms
Training without evaluation callbacks (hard to determine when to stop)

faq.question: Which algorithm should I choose for my task?
faq.answer: PPO for general-purpose tasks, SAC for continuous control, DQN for discrete actions. See algorithms.md for detailed comparison.

faq.question: Can I use this with GPU acceleration?
faq.answer: Stable Baselines3 uses PyTorch automatically. Set device='cuda' in model constructor for GPU training.

faq.question: How do I save and load trained models?
faq.answer: Use model.save(path) to save and PPO.load(path, env=env) to load. Save VecNormalize stats separately.

faq.question: Is my data safe during training?
faq.answer: This skill only reads/writes to user-specified directories. No data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: Why is training unstable?
faq.answer: Check reward scaling, try VecNormalize, verify observation space dtype is np.float32, and validate environment.

faq.question: How does this compare to RLlib?
faq.answer: Stable Baselines3 offers simpler APIs for single-agent RL, while RLlib scales better for distributed training.
